channel.title: Inline vs. Block Elements :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description:
Given that the role of HTML is markup, i.e. providing structure and formatting to text, HTML elements can broadly be categorized into two categories depending on how they affect the flow of text - inline and block. Inline elements referred to elements that maintained the flow of text, i.e. the bring attention to () element used in a paragraph of text, would bold the text without breaking the flow:

The quick brown fox lept over the log
